title: Hot Springs National Park: Volunteer
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Volunteer            Volunteer         Lakeside Middle School students provide volunteer maintenance on Gulpha Gorge Trail. NPS Photo by Brian Schwieger  Volunteers are an essential part of park operations at Hot Springs National Park.     Volunteer Opportunities at Hot Springs National Park Volunteering your time and talents to a worthy cause is an extremely rewarding experience. At Hot Springs National Park, we consider our mission to be an important one and are pleased that you are considering opportunities to share your talents with us. Preserving our nation's natural and cultural heritage is a challenging task that requires the involvement of all of us. At Hot Springs National Park, you will volunteer alongside a talented and dedicated workforce of National Park Service employees who are committed to the resources they protect and the public they serve, but who also recognize that your contributions are invaluable.  Together, we can accomplish far more that we can separately.For more information on the park's volunteer program, contact the Volunteer Coordinator, Brian Schwieger, at 501-620-6703 or click the link for email.       Current Volunteer Opportunities
